auth.logoutConfirm: Are you sure you want to sign out?

settings.displayNameHint: Your name shown throughout the system
settings.passwordRequired: Current password and new password are required
settings.passwordNotMatch: The new passwords do not match
settings.bindCodeExplain: Generate a code, then send it to the bot on Telegram/Feishu to link your account
settings.bindCodeTTLHint: How long the bind code stays valid

chat.greeting: Hi! How can I help you today?
chat.selectBotHint: Choose a bot from the sidebar to start chatting
chat.readonlyPlaceholder: This chat is read-only. Sending messages is disabled.
chat.noBot: No bots available, please create a bot first

models.title: Models
models.deleteModelConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this model?
models.emptyDescription: Click the button above to add a model for this provider
models.modelHint: Official model ID — must match the provider's API
models.displayNameHint: Shown in the UI; leave empty to use model ID
models.dimensionsHint: Output dimensions of the embedding model (embedding only)
models.multimodalHint: Whether this model supports image and other multimodal inputs
models.fallbackModelHint: Backup model used when the primary model is unavailable

provider.apiKeyHint: Secret key from the provider for API authentication
provider.urlHint: Provider's API endpoint, usually ending with /v1
provider.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this provider?
provider.emptyDescription: Add a model provider first to configure models

searchProvider.title: Search Providers
searchProvider.providerHint: Choose the type of search service
searchProvider.selectHint: Select or create a search provider
searchProvider.unsupportedProvider: This provider does not have a settings panel yet
searchProvider.emptyDescription: Add a search provider to configure web search
searchProvider.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this search provider? This action cannot be undone.

mcp.builtinDescription: Every bot comes with {count} built-in tools, no extra configuration needed

builtin.edit: Replace text in a file inside the container
builtin.exec: Execute a command in the container
builtin.send: Send a message to a channel or session
builtin.react: Add or remove emoji reaction on a message
builtin.lookupChannelUser: Look up a user or group by platform ID
builtin.searchMemory: Search memories relevant to the current chat
builtin.webSearch: Search the web via configured search provider
builtin.listSchedule: List schedules for the current bot

mcp.externalDescription: Add third-party MCP servers to extend bot capabilities
mcp.commandHint: Command to run inside the container, e.g. npx, node, python
mcp.argumentsHint: Arguments for the command — press Enter to add each one
mcp.cwdHint: Working directory for the MCP server inside the container
mcp.urlHint: Full URL of the remote MCP service
mcp.headersHint: HTTP headers sent with requests, often used for authentication
mcp.envHint: Runtime environment variables, commonly used for API keys
mcp.empty: No external MCP servers configured yet.
mcp.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this MCP server?
mcp.importHint: Paste a standard mcpServers JSON configuration. Existing servers with the same name will be updated.

sharedWorkspace.title: Shared Workspace
sharedWorkspace.subtitle: Cross-bot shared file directory. All bot containers mount /shared here.
sharedWorkspace.empty: No files in the shared workspace yet. Bots will create files during runtime.
sharedWorkspace.selectHint: Select a file from the left to view or edit.

bots.title: Bots
bots.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this bot?
bots.emptyDescription: Click the button above to create your first bot

templates.title: Choose a Template
templates.subtitle: Start with a pre-built persona, or create from scratch
templates.blankDescription: Start from scratch with an empty persona

descriptions.research-analyst: Deep web researcher with critical analysis skills
descriptions.code-architect: Pragmatic full-stack developer, simplicity over complexity
descriptions.daily-secretary: Efficient personal assistant for daily operations
descriptions.data-wrangler: Turns messy data into clear insights
descriptions.knowledge-curator: Personal knowledge architect — your second brain

bots.editAvatarDescription: Set the image URL for the bot avatar.
bots.typePersonalHint: Only you can chat with this bot
bots.typePublicHint: Multiple users can use this bot in groups

checks.title: Runtime Checks
checks.subtitle: Resource health is evaluated at request time.

files.title: Bot Files
files.subtitle: View and edit the template files in the bot's data directory (TOOLS.md, SOUL.md, IDENTITY.md, etc.)
files.empty: No files found. Create a container first to initialize template files.
files.selectHint: Select a file from the left to view or edit.

skills.title: Skills
skills.subtitle: Manage skills installed in the bot's container. Skills can also be installed by the bot via ClawHub.
skills.empty: No skills installed yet. Add one manually or let the bot install from ClawHub.
skills.createDescription: Create a new skill manually. The bot can also install skills from ClawHub automatically.
skills.descriptionPlaceholder: Brief description of what this skill does
skills.descriptionHint: The bot uses this to decide when to apply the skill

subagents.title: Subagents
subagents.subtitle: Subagents are automatically created and dispatched by the agent during conversations. You can also pre-register templates here — the agent will prioritize registered definitions.
subagents.nameHint: The bot dispatches subagents by name
subagents.descriptionHint: Describe the specialty — the bot assigns tasks based on this
subagents.skillsHint: Comma-separated skill names this subagent can use

heartbeat.title: Heartbeat
heartbeat.subtitle: Heartbeats let the bot act automatically on a schedule or after specific events. New bots get a default heartbeat (hourly). You can adjust the interval, prompt, and triggers.
heartbeat.empty: No heartbeat configurations. Add one to let the bot act proactively.
heartbeat.intervalHint: How often the heartbeat fires (minimum 10 seconds)
heartbeat.promptPlaceholder: What should the bot do when the heartbeat fires?
heartbeat.promptHint: Instruction sent to the bot when the heartbeat fires
heartbeat.eventTriggersHint: Additional events that trigger the heartbeat besides the timer
heartbeat.overviewSubtitle: Heartbeats give the bot the ability to act proactively — it can think, maintain, and evolve on its own without user prompts.
heartbeat.triggerEvent: Event: also fires when specific events occur
heartbeat.infoBannerDesc: A heartbeat is the bot's autonomous pulse — it fires periodically or on events, allowing the bot to perform maintenance (check tasks, organize notes), self-evolve (reflect on conversations and improve), or run any custom logic you define. Without heartbeats, the bot only responds when users talk to it.
heartbeat.infoTriggerPeriodic: Periodic — fires at a fixed interval (e.g., every hour)
heartbeat.infoTriggerEvent: Event-driven — fires when something happens (e.g., after a scheduled task completes)
heartbeat.infoTriggerManual: Manual — triggered via the management API on demand

history.title: Message History
history.subtitle: View the conversation history for this bot.
history.clearConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete all message history for this bot?

persona.identityPlaceholder:
Define who this bot is.
Example:
- Name: Atlas
- Role: Personal assistant
- Vibe: Warm, concise, proactive
persona.soulPlaceholder:
Define how this bot behaves.
Example:
- Be genuinely helpful, not performatively helpful
- Have opinions and preferences
- Keep private data private
persona.taskPlaceholder:
Define what this bot should do.
Example:
- You are a translation bot, only do Chinese-English translation
- Always reply in the same language as the user
persona.allowSelfEvolutionDescription: When enabled, the bot can modify its own IDENTITY.md, SOUL.md, and TOOLS.md files to evolve its personality over time.
persona.enableOpenvikingDescription: When enabled, the bot can use OpenViking's filesystem paradigm to manage memories, resources, and skills with tiered context loading and self-evolution.
persona.fromFile: Currently empty — placeholder below is from container file {file}. The agent uses it at runtime. Edit here to override.

container.title: Container Management
container.subtitle: Manage the runtime container attached to this bot.
container.containerExplain: The container is the bot's isolated sandbox for file I/O and command execution. Deleting it won't affect bot settings or memory.
container.snapshotExplain: A snapshot is a full backup of the container at a point in time, useful for rollback.
container.botNotReady: This bot is in lifecycle transition. Container actions are temporarily disabled.
container.empty: No container found for this bot. Create one to enable runtime tooling.
container.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this container?

snapshotActions.deleteConfirmDesc: This snapshot will be permanently deleted. This action cannot be undone.

evolution.title: Self-Evolution
evolution.subtitle: The bot evolves its personality through conversations, logging experiments and reflections.
evolution.enabledHint: Self-evolution is enabled. The bot records its evolution in EXPERIMENTS.md.
evolution.disabledHint: Self-evolution is disabled. Enable it to let the bot modify its own files and evolve.
evolution.noExperiments: No experiments recorded yet. The bot will start recording after its next reflection.
evolution.selectFile: Select a file to view its contents
evolution.fileNotFound: File not found or not yet created
evolution.heartbeatPending: Evolution heartbeat is being set up. If the button stays grey, try toggling the switch off and on.
evolution.historyEmpty: No evolution runs recorded yet. Evolution logs will appear here after the first reflection cycle.

capabilities.title: Container Capabilities
capabilities.subtitle: The following capabilities are pre-installed in the bot container image, ready to use.
capabilities.actionbook: Pre-compiled website operation manuals for faster web interactions
capabilities.smartFetch: Three-level strategy: Markdown Header → Actionbook → curl
capabilities.clawhub: Skill marketplace CLI — install community skills with one command

settings.sectionModelsHint: Choose which AI models the bot uses for different tasks
settings.sectionBehaviorHint: Control how the bot responds and manages conversation context
settings.chatModelHint: The AI model used for conversations
settings.memoryModelHint: Model used to organize and compress memories
settings.embeddingModelHint: Converts text to vectors for memory search; changing requires memory rebuild
settings.vlmModelHint: Vision/multimodal model used by OpenViking for image understanding. Defaults to Chat Model if not set
settings.searchProviderHint: Service used when the bot searches the web
settings.maxContextLoadTimeHint: Max seconds to load context per conversation, 0 = unlimited
settings.languageHint: Default reply language; leave empty to follow the user's language
settings.taskDescription: Define the bot's current task objective. The agent references this on every conversation.
settings.taskPlaceholder:
Define what this bot should do.
Example:
- You are a translation bot, only do Chinese-English translation
- Always reply in the same language as the user
settings.allowSelfEvolutionDescription: When enabled, the bot can modify its own IDENTITY.md, SOUL.md, and TOOLS.md files to evolve its personality over time.
settings.enableOpenvikingDescription: When enabled, the bot uses OpenViking's tiered context database for memory and knowledge management. ov.conf is auto-generated from your current model settings.
settings.isPrivilegedDescription: Privileged bots can create and manage other bots, models, and providers through conversation.
settings.isPrivilegedHint: Grant this bot admin management capabilities
settings.allowGuestPersonalHint: Personal bots do not support guest access. Use a public bot instead.
settings.allowGuestHint: Allow unbound users to use this bot directly via platforms
settings.deleteBotDescription: Deleting this bot cannot be undone. Proceed with caution.

channels.title: Platforms
channels.emptyDescription: Click below to add an access platform for this bot
channels.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to remove this platform?
channels.noAvailableTypes: All platform types have been configured

schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.emptyDescription: Bots can create schedules via chat, or you can add them via API
schedules.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this schedule?

memory.title: Here lie the memories.
memory.compactConfirm: Are you sure you want to compact the memory? This will merge similar content using AI and may reduce the number of entries.
memory.compactRatioAggressiveDesc: Heavily consolidate, keep core facts only.
memory.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this memory? This cannot be undone.

tokenUsage.title: Token Usage
tokenUsage.subtitle: Monitor token consumption across all bots.

logs.title: Process Logs
logs.subtitle: View the complete flow from user input to LLM response.
